answers.q: is calcium sulfite soluble in water
answers.a: It is only slightly soluble in water; its solubility increases in acidic conditions due to formation of bisulfite.

answers.q: what is the formula for calcium sulfite
answers.a: CaSO3, commonly encountered as hydrates such as CaSO3·½H2O (hemihydrate) or CaSO3·4H2O (tetrahydrate).

answers.q: 1. how many grams of ca2+ are present in 4.28 grams of calcium sulfite?
answers.a: About 1.43 g of Ca2+, assuming anhydrous CaSO3 (4.28 g × 40.08/120.16).

answers.q: balance calcium sulfite decomposes when heated to form calcium oxide and sulfur dioxide

answers.a: E226 is the food additive code for calcium sulphite; the rest of the query appears unrelated to this additive.
